oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ring of Ludwig II, King of Bavaria, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A styled “King Ludwig ring,” a replica made by the B. F. Stief company of Nashville, Tennessee. The B. F. Stief Jewelry Company, one of the South’s outstanding jewelry establishments, originated at the beginning of the Civil War. Pertaining to this specific ring (pictured), the notation on the photograph sleeve cites “owned by Mrs. John G. Frank.” In the 19th century the King of Bavaria (King Ludwig II) gave away replicas of his originally designed ring to friends and beneficiaries. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
